intro: Helleborine thunbergii, commonly known as the broad-leaf helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and woodland areas. It produces small, elongated seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its spread. Helleborine thunbergii is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
